text.0: bring forth your sacred song ye prudent singers even as are the thoughts of human beings.
text.1: let us draw indra with true deeds anear us he loves our songs the hero and is potent.
text.2: the hymn shone brightly from the seat of worship to the kine came the bull the heifers offipring.
text.3: with mighty bellowing hath he arisen and hath pervaded even the spacious regions.
text.4: indra knows verily how to hear our singing for he victorious made a path for sūrya.
text.5: he made the cow and be became the sovran of heaven primeval matchless and unshaken.
text.6: praised by aṅgirases indra demolished with might the works of the great watery monster.
text.7: full many regions too hath he pervaded and by his truth supported earths foundation.
text.8: the counterpart of heaven and earth is indra he knoweth all libations slayeth Śuṣṇa.
text.9: the vast sky with the sun hath he extended and best otpillars stayed it with a pillar.
text.10: the vṛtraslaver with his bolt felled vṛtra the magic of the godless waxen mighty.
text.11: here hast thou bold assailant boldly conquered yea then thine arms o maghavan were potent.
text.12: when the dawns come attendant upon sūrya their rays discover wealth of divers colours.
text.13: the star of heaven is seen as twere approaching none knoweth aught of it as it departeth.
text.14: far have they gone the first of all these waters the waters that flowed forth when indra sent them.
text.15: where is their spring and where is their foundation where now ye waters is your inmost centre.
text.16: thou didst free rivers swallowed by the dragon and rapidly they set themselves in motion.
text.17: those that were loosed and those that longed for freedom excited now to speed they run unresting.
text.18: yearning together they have sped to sindhu the fortdestroyer praised of old hath loved them.
text.19: indra may thy terrestrial treasures reach us and our full songs of joy approach thy dwelling.
